sen.j: 東密（とうみつ）とは、真言宗に伝わる密教のことである。
sen.e: Tomitsu is an esoteric form of Buddhism that is the tradition of Shingon Buddhism.
Tomitsu is Esoteric Buddhism that has been passed down in Shingon Buddhism.
sen.cmt: 「an esoteric form of Buddhism」よりも、用語集にあるように「Esoteric Buddhism」の方が広く使われているようです。Is the tradition of >> has been passed down in と書き換えました。
sen.e: Tomitsu is Esoteric Buddhism that has been passed down in Shingon Buddhism.

sen.j: 天台宗に伝わる密教を台密と呼ぶのに対していう。
sen.e: This term is used to differentiate this form with Taimitsu, the esoteric form of religious practice of Tendai Buddhism.
This term is used to differentiate it from Taimitsu, which is Esoteric Buddhism passed down in Tendai Buddhism.
This term is used to differentiate it from Taimitsu, which is Esoteric Buddhism passed down in Tendai Buddhism.

sen.j: 東密の語の由来は、空海が東寺を真言密教の根本道場としたことによるものである。
sen.e: The name derives from the fact that the monk Kukai chose Toji Temple as the seminary for Shingon Buddhism.
The name Tomitsu derived from the fact that the monk Kukai chose To-ji Temple as konpon dojo-seminary for Shingon Esoteric Buddhism.
sen.cmt: Toji >> To-jiと書き換えました。Derives >> derivedに書き換えました。「東密の」が訳漏れです。真言密教の訳はShingon Esoteric Buddhismです。根本道場の訳は用語集どおり、konpon dojo-seminaryを使用しました。
sen.e: The name Tomitsu derived from the fact that the monk Kukai chose To-ji Temple as konpon dojo-seminary for Shingon Esoteric Buddhism.

sen.j: 本有学派・修生学派の２つがある。
sen.e: This Buddhist branch consists of the Honyu and Shusei schools.
sen.cmt: 本有学派: Honyu school修生学派: Shusei school
sen.e: It consists of two schools, Honyu School and Shusei School.
It consists of two schools, Honyu School and Shusei School.

sen.j: 東密では、高野山・東寺・根来山を併せて三大学風と称する。
sen.e: Under Tomitsu, the temples of Mount Koya, Toji and Negoroji are called the Three Great Centers of Learning.
sen.cmt: 三大学風: Three Great Centers of Learning
sen.e: Under Tomitsu, Mt. Koya (Kongobu-ji Temple), To-ji Temple and Mt. Negoro (Negoro-ji Temple) are called the Three Great Centers of Learning.
sen.cmt: 用語集どおり、Mt. Koya、To-ji Temple、Mt. Negoro と表記し、高野山と根来山については、補足で金剛峰寺と根来寺と記入しました。
sen.e: Under Tomitsu, Mt. Koya (Kongobu-ji Temple), To-ji Temple and Mt. Negoro (Negoro-ji Temple) are called the Three Great Centers of Learning.

sen.j: 主にこの3箇所を中心にして、教学の研鑽・研究・発展が見られた。
sen.e: These three centers served chiefly as the place for training, research and advancement of the religion.
These three locations served as centers for training, research and advancement of the religion.
sen.cmt: 不要なスペースを削除しました。centers served chiefly as the place for >> loactions served as centers for と修正しました。
sen.e: These three locations served as centers for training, research and advancement of the religion.

sen.j: 806年（大同_(日本)元年）唐から帰朝した空海は、密教のみが悟りの境地へ深達するための真実門であるとして、東寺（現在の教王護国寺）を中心に真言密教を広めた。
sen.e: When the monk Kukai returned to Japan from Tang China in 806, he announced that esoteric Buddhism is the "gate of truth" in reaching higher into the dimension of "satori" (enlightenment) and spread Shingon Buddhism from Toji Temple (present-day Kyoogokoku-ji).

When the monk Kukai returned to Japan from Tang China in 806, he spread Shingon Buddhism around Toji Temple (present Kyoogokoku-ji) preaching that the only Esoteric Buddhism is the "gate of truth" to reach depth of "satori" (enlightenment).
sen.cmt: esoteric をEsotericと修正しました。Present-day >> presentと修正しました。「のみ」が訳漏れです。書き換えました。
sen.e: When the monk Kukai returned to Japan from Tang China in 806, he spread Shingon Buddhism around Toji Temple (present Kyoogokoku-ji) preaching that the only Esoteric Buddhism is the "gate of truth" to reach depth of "satori" (enlightenment).

sen.j: その後、広沢流・小野流の2流に分かれ、さらに数多くの派に分かれていった。
sen.e: Shingon Buddhism later split into the Hirosawa school and the Ono school, which again multiplied into various sects.
